960  //============================================================================
961  // Method Description:
973  template<typename dtype>
974  bool allclose(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2, double inTolerance)
975  {
976  if (inArray1.shape() != inArray2.shape())
977  {
978  std::string errStr = "ERROR: allclose: input array dimensions are not consistant.";
979  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
980  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
981  }
982 
983  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray1.size(); ++i)
984  {
985  if (std::abs(inArray1[i] - inArray2[i]) > inTolerance)
986  {
987  return false;
988  }
989  }
990 
991  return true;
992  }

1045  //============================================================================
1046  // Method Description:
1059  template<typename dtype>
1060  NdArray<dtype> append(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<dtype>& inAppendValues, Axis inAxis)
1061  {
1062  switch (inAxis)
1063  {
1064  case Axis::NONE:
1065  {
1066  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inArray.size() + inAppendValues.size());
1067  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin());
1068  std::copy(inAppendValues.cbegin(), inAppendValues.cend(), returnArray.begin() + inArray.size());
1069 
1070  return std::move(returnArray);
1071  }
1072  case Axis::ROW:
1073  {
1074  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
1075  Shape appendShape = inAppendValues.shape();
1076  if (inShape.cols != appendShape.cols)
1077  {
1078  std::string errStr = "ERROR: append: all the input array dimensions except for the concatenation axis must match exactly";
1079  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1080  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1081  }
1082 
1083  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows + appendShape.rows, inShape.cols);
1084  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin());
1085  std::copy(inAppendValues.cbegin(), inAppendValues.cend(), returnArray.begin() + inArray.size());
1086 
1087  return std::move(returnArray);
1088  }
1089  case Axis::COL:
1090  {
1091  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
1092  Shape appendShape = inAppendValues.shape();
1093  if (inShape.rows != appendShape.rows)
1094  {
1095  std::string errStr = "ERROR: append: all the input array dimensions except for the concatenation axis must match exactly";
1096  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1097  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1098  }
1099 
1100  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows, inShape.cols + appendShape.cols);
1101  for (uint32 row = 0; row < returnArray.shape().rows; ++row)
1102  {
1103  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), returnArray.begin(row));
1104  std::copy(inAppendValues.cbegin(row), inAppendValues.cend(row), returnArray.begin(row) + inShape.cols);
1105  }
1106 
1107  return std::move(returnArray);
1108  }
1109  default:
1110  {
1111  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
1112  // of the compiler warning.
1113  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
1114  }
1115  }
1116  }
1117 
1118  //============================================================================
1119  // Method Description:
1138  template<typename dtype>
1139  NdArray<dtype> arange(dtype inStart, dtype inStop, dtype inStep)
1140  {
1141  if (inStep > 0 && inStop < inStart)
1142  {
1143  std::string errStr = "ERROR: arange: stop value must be larger than the start value for positive step.";
1144  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1145  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1146  }
1147 
1148  if (inStep < 0 && inStop > inStart)
1149  {
1150  std::string errStr = "ERROR: arange: start value must be larger than the stop value for negative step.";
1151  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1152  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1153  }
1154 
1155  std::vector<dtype> values;
1156 
1157  dtype theValue = inStart;
1158 
1159  if (inStep > 0)
1160  {
1161  while (theValue < inStop)
1162  {
1163  values.push_back(theValue);
1164  theValue += static_cast<dtype>(inStep);
1165  }
1166  }
1167  else
1168  {
1169  while (theValue > inStop)
1170  {
1171  values.push_back(theValue);
1172  theValue += static_cast<dtype>(inStep);
1173  }
1174  }
1175 
1176  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(values));
1177  }
1178 
1179  //============================================================================
1180  // Method Description:
1198  template<typename dtype>
1199  NdArray<dtype> arange(dtype inStop)
1200  {
1201  if (inStop <= 0)
1202  {
1203  std::string errStr = "ERROR: arange: stop value must ge greater than 0.";
1204  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1205  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1206  }
1207 
1208  return std::move(arange<dtype>(0, inStop, 1));
1209  }

1705  //============================================================================
1706  // Method Description:
1717  template<typename dtype>
1718  NdArray<double> average(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<dtype>& inWeights, Axis inAxis)
1719  {
1720  switch (inAxis)
1721  {
1722  case Axis::NONE:
1723  {
1724  if (inWeights.shape() != inArray.shape())
1725  {
1726  std::string errStr = "ERROR: average: input array and weight values are not consistant.";
1727  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1728  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1729  }
1730 
1731  NdArray<double> weightedArray(inArray.shape());
1732  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), inWeights.cbegin(), weightedArray.begin(), std::multiplies<double>());
1733 
1734  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(weightedArray.begin(), weightedArray.end(), 0.0));
1735  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum /= inWeights.template sum<double>().item() };
1736 
1737  return std::move(returnArray);
1738  }
1739  case Axis::COL:
1740  {
1741  Shape arrayShape = inArray.shape();
1742  if (inWeights.size() != arrayShape.cols)
1743  {
1744  std::string errStr = "ERROR: average: input array and weights value are not consistant.";
1745  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1746  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1747  }
1748 
1749  double weightSum = inWeights.template sum<double>().item();
1750  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, arrayShape.rows);
1751  for (uint32 row = 0; row < arrayShape.rows; ++row)
1752  {
1753  NdArray<double> weightedArray(1, arrayShape.cols);
1754  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), inWeights.cbegin(), weightedArray.begin(), std::multiplies<double>());
1755 
1756  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(weightedArray.begin(), weightedArray.end(), 0.0));
1757  returnArray(0, row) = sum / weightSum;
1758  }
1759 
1760  return std::move(returnArray);
1761  }
1762  case Axis::ROW:
1763  {
1764  if (inWeights.size() != inArray.shape().rows)
1765  {
1766  std::string errStr = "ERROR: average: input array and weight values are not consistant.";
1767  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1768  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1769  }
1770 
1771  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
1772 
1773  Shape transShape = transposedArray.shape();
1774  double weightSum = inWeights.template sum<double>().item();
1775  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, transShape.rows);
1776  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
1777  {
1778  NdArray<double> weightedArray(1, transShape.cols);
1779  std::transform(transposedArray.cbegin(row), transposedArray.cend(row), inWeights.cbegin(), weightedArray.begin(), std::multiplies<double>());
1780 
1781  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(weightedArray.begin(), weightedArray.end(), 0.0));
1782  returnArray(0, row) = sum / weightSum;
1783  }
1784 
1785  return std::move(returnArray);
1786  }
1787  default:
1788  {
1789  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
1790  // of the compiler warning.
1791  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
1792  }
1793  }
1794  }

1796  //============================================================================
1797  // Method Description:
1814  template<typename dtype>
1815  NdArray<dtype> bincount(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint16 inMinLength)
1816  {
1817  // only works with integer input types
1818  static_assert(DtypeInfo<dtype>::isInteger(), "ERROR: bincount: can only use with integer types.");
1819 
1820  dtype maxValue = inArray.max().item();
1821  if (maxValue < 0)
1822  {
1823  // no positive values so just return an empty array
1824  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
1825  }
1826 
1827  if (maxValue + 1 > DtypeInfo<dtype>::max())
1828  {
1829  std::string errStr = "Error: bincount: array values too large, will result in gigantic array that will take up alot of memory...";
1830  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1831  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1832  }
1833 
1834  uint16 outArraySize = std::max(static_cast<uint16>(maxValue + 1), inMinLength);
1835  NdArray<dtype> clippedArray = inArray.clip(0, maxValue);
1836 
1837  NdArray<dtype> outArray(1, outArraySize);
1838  outArray.zeros();
1839  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
1840  {
1841  ++outArray[clippedArray[i]];
1842  }
1843 
1844  return std::move(outArray);
1845  }
1846 
1847  //============================================================================
1848  // Method Description:
1868  template<typename dtype>
1869  NdArray<dtype> bincount(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<dtype>& inWeights, uint16 inMinLength)
1870  {
1871  // only works with integer input types
1872  static_assert(DtypeInfo<dtype>::isInteger(), "ERROR: bincount: can only use with integer types.");
1873 
1874  if (inArray.shape() != inWeights.shape())
1875  {
1876  std::string errStr = "ERROR: bincount: weights array must be the same shape as the input array.";
1877  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1878  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1879  }
1880 
1881  dtype maxValue = inArray.max().item();
1882  if (maxValue < 0)
1883  {
1884  // no positive values so just return an empty array
1885  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
1886  }
1887 
1888  if (maxValue + 1 > DtypeInfo<dtype>::max())
1889  {
1890  std::string errStr = "Error: bincount: array values too large, will result in gigantic array that will take up alot of memory...";
1891  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1892  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1893  }
1894 
1895  uint16 outArraySize = std::max(static_cast<uint16>(maxValue + 1), inMinLength);
1896  NdArray<dtype> clippedArray = inArray.clip(0, maxValue);
1897 
1898  NdArray<dtype> outArray(1, outArraySize);
1899  outArray.zeros();
1900  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
1901  {
1902  outArray[clippedArray[i]] += inWeights[i];
1903  }
1904 
1905  return std::move(outArray);
1906  }

2099  //============================================================================
2100  // Method Description:
2110  template<typename dtype>
2111  NdArray<dtype> column_stack(const std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >& inArrayList)
2112  {
2113  // first loop through to calculate the final size of the array
2114  typename std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >::iterator iter;
2115  Shape finalShape;
2116  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
2117  {
2118  if (finalShape.isnull())
2119  {
2120  finalShape = iter->shape();
2121  }
2122  else if (iter->shape().rows != finalShape.rows)
2123  {
2124  std::string errStr = "ERROR: column_stack: input arrays must have the same number of rows.";
2125  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2126  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2127  }
2128  else
2129  {
2130  finalShape.cols += iter->shape().cols;
2131  }
2132  }
2133 
2134  // now that we know the final size, contruct the output array
2135  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(finalShape);
2136  uint32 colStart = 0;
2137  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
2138  {
2139  Shape theShape = iter->shape();
2140  for (uint32 row = 0; row < theShape.rows; ++row)
2141  {
2142  for (uint32 col = 0; col < theShape.cols; ++col)
2143  {
2144  returnArray(row, colStart + col) = iter->operator()(row, col);
2145  }
2146  }
2147  colStart += theShape.cols;
2148  }
2149 
2150  return std::move(returnArray);
2151  }
2152 
2153  //============================================================================
2154  // Method Description:
2164  template<typename dtype>
2165  NdArray<dtype> concatenate(const std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >& inArrayList, Axis inAxis)
2166  {
2167  switch (inAxis)
2168  {
2169  case Axis::NONE:
2170  {
2171  uint32 finalSize = 0;
2172  typename std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >::iterator iter;
2173  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
2174  {
2175  finalSize += iter->size();
2176  }
2177 
2178  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, finalSize);
2179  uint32 offset = 0;
2180  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
2181  {
2182  std::copy(iter->cbegin(), iter->cend(), returnArray.begin() + offset);
2183  offset += iter->size();
2184  }
2185 
2186  return std::move(returnArray);
2187  }
2188  case Axis::ROW:
2189  {
2190  return std::move(row_stack(inArrayList));
2191  }
2192  case Axis::COL:
2193  {
2194  return std::move(column_stack(inArrayList));
2195  }
2196  default:
2197  {
2198  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2199  // of the compiler warning.
2200  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2201  }
2202  }
2203  }

2359  // Method Description:
2369  template<typename dtype>
2370  NdArray<uint32> count_nonzero(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
2371  {
2372  switch (inAxis)
2373  {
2374  case Axis::NONE:
2375  {
2376  NdArray<uint32> count = { inArray.nonzero().size() };
2377  return count;
2378  }
2379  case Axis::COL:
2380  {
2381  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2382 
2383  NdArray<uint32> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
2384  returnArray.zeros();
2385  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2386  {
2387  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2388  {
2389  if (inArray(row, col) != static_cast<dtype>(0))
2390  {
2391  ++returnArray(0, row);
2392  }
2393  }
2394  }
2395 
2396  return std::move(returnArray);
2397  }
2398  case Axis::ROW:
2399  {
2400  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2401 
2402  NdArray<uint32> returnArray(1, inShape.cols);
2403  returnArray.zeros();
2404  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2405  {
2406  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2407  {
2408  if (inArray(row, col) != static_cast<dtype>(0))
2409  {
2410  ++returnArray(0, col);
2411  }
2412  }
2413  }
2414 
2415  return std::move(returnArray);
2416  }
2417  default:
2418  {
2419  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2420  // of the compiler warning.
2421  return std::move(NdArray<uint32>(0));
2422  }
2423  }
2424  }

2426  //============================================================================
2427  // Method Description:
2438  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
2439  NdArray<dtypeOut> cross(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2, Axis inAxis)
2440  {
2441  if (inArray1.shape() != inArray2.shape())
2442  {
2443  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: the input array dimensions are not consistant.";
2444  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2445  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2446  }
2447 
2448  switch (inAxis)
2449  {
2450  case Axis::NONE:
2451  {
2452  uint32 arraySize = inArray1.size();
2453  if (arraySize != inArray2.size() || arraySize < 2 || arraySize > 3)
2454  {
2455  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: incompatible dimensions for cross product (dimension must be 2 or 3)";
2456  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2457  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2458  }
2459 
2460  NdArray<dtype> in1 = inArray1.flatten();
2461  NdArray<dtype> in2 = inArray2.flatten();
2462 
2463  switch (arraySize)
2464  {
2465  case 2:
2466  {
2467  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[0]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[1])
2468  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[1]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[0]) };
2469  return std::move(returnArray);
2470  }
2471  case 3:
2472  {
2473  dtypeOut i = static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[1]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[2])
2474  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[2]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[1]);
2475  dtypeOut j = -(static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[0]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[2])
2476  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[2]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[0]));
2477  dtypeOut k = (static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[0]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[1])
2478  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[1]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[0]));
2479 
2480  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { i, j, k };
2481  return std::move(returnArray);
2482  }
2483  default:
2484  {
2485  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2486  // of the compiler warning.
2487  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
2488  }
2489  }
2490  }
2491  case Axis::ROW:
2492  {
2493  Shape arrayShape = inArray1.shape();
2494  if (arrayShape != inArray2.shape() || arrayShape.rows < 2 || arrayShape.rows > 3)
2495  {
2496  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: incompatible dimensions for cross product (dimension must be 2 or 3)";
2497  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2498  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2499  }
2500 
2501  Shape returnArrayShape;
2502  if (arrayShape.rows == 2)
2503  {
2504  returnArrayShape = Shape(1, arrayShape.cols);
2505  }
2506  else
2507  {
2508  returnArrayShape = Shape(3, arrayShape.cols);
2509  }
2510 
2511  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(returnArrayShape);
2512  for (uint32 col = 0; col < arrayShape.cols; ++col)
2513  {
2514  int32 theCol = static_cast<int32>(col);
2515  NdArray<dtype> vec1 = inArray1({ 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.rows) }, { theCol, theCol + 1 });
2516  NdArray<dtype> vec2 = inArray2({ 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.rows) }, { theCol, theCol + 1 });
2517  NdArray<dtypeOut> vecCross = cross<dtypeOut>(vec1, vec2, Axis::NONE);
2518 
2519  returnArray.put({ 0, static_cast<int32>(returnArrayShape.rows) }, { theCol, theCol + 1 }, vecCross);
2520  }
2521 
2522  return std::move(returnArray);
2523  }
2524  case Axis::COL:
2525  {
2526  Shape arrayShape = inArray1.shape();
2527  if (arrayShape != inArray2.shape() || arrayShape.cols < 2 || arrayShape.cols > 3)
2528  {
2529  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: incompatible dimensions for cross product (dimension must be 2 or 3)";
2530  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2531  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2532  }
2533 
2534  Shape returnArrayShape;
2535  if (arrayShape.cols == 2)
2536  {
2537  returnArrayShape = Shape(arrayShape.rows, 1);
2538  }
2539  else
2540  {
2541  returnArrayShape = Shape(arrayShape.rows, 3);
2542  }
2543 
2544  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(returnArrayShape);
2545  for (uint32 row = 0; row < arrayShape.rows; ++row)
2546  {
2547  int32 theRow = static_cast<int32>(row);
2548  NdArray<dtype> vec1 = inArray1({ theRow, theRow + 1 }, { 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.cols) });
2549  NdArray<dtype> vec2 = inArray2({ theRow, theRow + 1 }, { 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.cols) });
2550  NdArray<dtypeOut> vecCross = cross<dtypeOut>(vec1, vec2, Axis::NONE);
2551 
2552  returnArray.put({ theRow, theRow + 1 }, { 0, static_cast<int32>(returnArrayShape.cols) }, vecCross);
2553  }
2554 
2555  return std::move(returnArray);
2556  }
2557  default:
2558  {
2559  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2560  // of the compiler warning.
2561  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
2562  }
2563  }
2564  }
2565

2579  }

2670  //============================================================================
2671  // Method Description:
2680  template<typename dtype>
2681  NdArray<dtype> deleteIndices(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<uint32>& inArrayIdxs, Axis inAxis)
2682  {
2683  // make sure that the indices are unique first
2684  NdArray<uint32> indices = unique(inArrayIdxs);
2685 
2686  switch (inAxis)
2687  {
2688  case Axis::NONE:
2689  {
2690  std::vector<dtype> values;
2691  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
2692  {
2693  if (indices.contains(i).item())
2694  {
2695  continue;
2696  }
2697 
2698  values.push_back(inArray[i]);
2699  }
2700 
2701  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(values));
2702  }
2703  case Axis::ROW:
2704  {
2705  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2706  if (indices.max().item() >= inShape.rows)
2707  {
2708  std::string errStr = "ERROR: deleteIndices: input index value is greater than the number of rows in the array.";
2709  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2710  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2711  }
2712 
2713  uint32 numNewRows = inShape.rows - indices.size();
2714  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(numNewRows, inShape.cols);
2715 
2716  uint32 rowCounter = 0;
2717  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2718  {
2719  if (indices.contains(row).item())
2720  {
2721  continue;
2722  }
2723 
2724  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2725  {
2726  returnArray(rowCounter, col) = inArray(row, col);
2727  }
2728  ++rowCounter;
2729  }
2730 
2731  return std::move(returnArray);
2732  }
2733  case Axis::COL:
2734  {
2735  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2736  if (indices.max().item() >= inShape.cols)
2737  {
2738  std::string errStr = "ERROR: deleteIndices: input index value is greater than the number of cols in the array.";
2739  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2740  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2741  }
2742 
2743  uint32 numNewCols = inShape.cols - indices.size();
2744  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows, numNewCols);
2745 
2746  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2747  {
2748  uint32 colCounter = 0;
2749  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2750  {
2751  if (indices.contains(col).item())
2752  {
2753  continue;
2754  }
2755 
2756  returnArray(row, colCounter++) = inArray(row, col);
2757  }
2758  }
2759 
2760  return std::move(returnArray);
2761 
2762 
2763  }
2764  default:
2765  {
2766  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2767  // of the compiler warning.
2768  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2769  }
2770  }
2771  }
2772 
2773  //============================================================================
2774  // Method Description:
2783  template<typename dtype>
2784  NdArray<dtype> deleteIndices(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const Slice& inIndicesSlice, Axis inAxis)
2785  {
2786  Slice sliceCopy(inIndicesSlice);
2787 
2788  switch (inAxis)
2789  {
2790  case Axis::NONE:
2791  {
2792  sliceCopy.makePositiveAndValidate(inArray.size());
2793  break;
2794  }
2795  case Axis::ROW:
2796  {
2797  sliceCopy.makePositiveAndValidate(inArray.shape().cols);
2798  break;
2799  }
2800  case Axis::COL:
2801  {
2802  sliceCopy.makePositiveAndValidate(inArray.shape().rows);
2803  break;
2804  }
2805  }
2806 
2807  std::vector<uint32> indices;
2808  for (uint32 i = static_cast<uint32>(sliceCopy.start); i < static_cast<uint32>(sliceCopy.stop); i += sliceCopy.step)
2809  {
2810  indices.push_back(i);
2811  }
2812 
2813  return std::move(deleteIndices(inArray, NdArray<uint32>(indices), inAxis));
2814  }

2828  {
2829  NdArray<uint32> inIndices = { inIndex };
2830  return std::move(deleteIndices(inArray, inIndices, inAxis));

2875  //============================================================================
2876  // Method Description:
2887  template<typename dtype>
2888  NdArray<dtype> diff(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
2889  {
2890  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2891 
2892  switch (inAxis)
2893  {
2894  case Axis::NONE:
2895  {
2896  if (inArray.size() < 2)
2897  {
2898  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2899  }
2900 
2901  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inArray.size() - 1);
2902  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend() - 1, inArray.cbegin() + 1, returnArray.begin(),
2903  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return inValue2 - inValue1; });
2904 
2905  return std::move(returnArray);
2906  }
2907  case Axis::COL:
2908  {
2909  if (inShape.cols < 2)
2910  {
2911  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2912  }
2913 
2914  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows, inShape.cols - 1);
2915  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2916  {
2917  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row) - 1, inArray.cbegin(row) + 1, returnArray.begin(row),
2918  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return inValue2 - inValue1; });
2919  }
2920 
2921  return std::move(returnArray);
2922  }
2923  case Axis::ROW:
2924  {
2925  if (inShape.rows < 2)
2926  {
2927  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2928  }
2929 
2930  NdArray<dtype> transArray = inArray.transpose();
2931  Shape transShape = transArray.shape();
2932  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(transShape.rows, transShape.cols - 1);
2933  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
2934  {
2935  std::transform(transArray.cbegin(row), transArray.cend(row) - 1, transArray.cbegin(row) + 1, returnArray.begin(row),
2936  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return inValue2 - inValue1; });
2937  }
2938 
2939  return std::move(returnArray.transpose());
2940  }
2941  default:
2942  {
2943  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2944  // of the compiler warning.
2945  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2946  }
2947  }
2948  }

3377  {

3389  return std::move(returnArray);

3391  case Axis::ROW:
3392  {
3393  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = inArray.transpose();
3394  for (uint32 row = 0; row < returnArray.shape().rows; ++row)
3395  {
3396  std::reverse(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.end(row));
3397  }
3398  return std::move(returnArray.transpose());
3399  }
3400  default:
3401  {
3402  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
3403  }
3404  }

3672  //============================================================================
3673  // Method Description:
3685  template<typename dtype>
3686  NdArray<dtype> fromfile(const std::string& inFilename, const std::string& inSep)
3687  {
3688  boost::filesystem::path p(inFilename);
3689  if (!boost::filesystem::exists(inFilename))
3690  {
3691  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: input filename does not exist.\n\t" + inFilename;
3692  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3693  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3694  }
3695 
3696  if (inSep.compare("") == 0)
3697  {
3698  // read in as binary file
3699  std::ifstream in(inFilename.c_str(), std::ios::in | std::ios::binary);
3700  in.seekg(0, in.end);
3701  uint32 fileSize = static_cast<uint32>(in.tellg());
3702 
3703  FILE* filePtr = fopen(inFilename.c_str(), "rb");
3704  if (filePtr == NULL)
3705  {
3706  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: unable to open the file.";
3707  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3708  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3709  }
3710 
3711  char* fileBuffer = new char[fileSize];
3712  size_t bytesRead = fread(fileBuffer, sizeof(char), fileSize, filePtr);
3713  fclose(filePtr);
3714 
3715  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(reinterpret_cast<dtype*>(fileBuffer), bytesRead);
3716  delete[] fileBuffer;
3717 
3718  return std::move(returnArray);
3719  }
3720  else
3721  {
3722  // read in as txt file
3723  if (!(inSep.compare(" ") == 0 || inSep.compare("\t") == 0 || inSep.compare("\n") == 0))
3724  {
3725  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: only [' ', '\\t', '\\n'] seperators are supported";
3726  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3727  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3728  }
3729 
3730  std::vector<dtype> values;
3731 
3732  std::ifstream file(inFilename.c_str());
3733  if (file.is_open())
3734  {
3735  while (!file.eof())
3736  {
3737  std::string line;
3738  std::getline(file, line);
3739 
3740  std::istringstream iss(line);
3741  try
3742  {
3743  values.push_back(static_cast<dtype>(std::stod(iss.str())));
3744  }
3745  catch (const std::invalid_argument& ia)
3746  {
3747  std::cout << "Warning: fromfile: " << ia.what() << std::endl;
3749  }
3750  }
3751  file.close();
3752  }
3753  else
3754  {
3755  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: unable to open file.";
3756  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3757  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3758  }
3759 
3760  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(values));
3761  }
3762  }

3873  //============================================================================
3874  // Method Description:
3886  template<typename dtype>
3887  std::pair<NdArray<uint32>, NdArray<double> > histogram(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint32 inNumBins)
3888  {
3889  if (inNumBins == 0)
3890  {
3891  std::string errStr = "ERROR: histogram: number of bins must be positive.";
3892  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3893  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3894  }
3895 
3896  NdArray<uint32> histo = zeros<uint32>(1, inNumBins);
3897 
3898  bool useEndPoint = true;
3899  NdArray<double> binEdges = linspace(static_cast<double>(inArray.min().item()),
3900  static_cast<double>(inArray.max().item()), inNumBins + 1, useEndPoint);
3901 
3902  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
3903  {
3904  // binary search to find the bin idx
3905  bool keepSearching = true;
3906  uint32 lowIdx = 0;
3907  uint32 highIdx = binEdges.size() - 1;
3908  while (keepSearching)
3909  {
3910  uint32 idx = (lowIdx + highIdx) / 2; // integer division
3911  if (lowIdx == highIdx || lowIdx == highIdx - 1)
3912  {
3913  // we found the bin
3914  ++histo[lowIdx];
3915  break;
3916  }
3917 
3918  if (inArray[i] > binEdges[idx])
3919  {
3920  lowIdx = idx;
3921  }
3922  else if (inArray[i] < binEdges[idx])
3923  {
3924  highIdx = idx;
3925  }
3926  else
3927  {
3928  // we found the bin
3929  ++histo[idx];
3930  break;
3931  }
3932  }
3933  }
3934 
3935  return std::move(std::make_pair(histo, binEdges));
3936  }

4053  //============================================================================
4054  // Method Description:
4071  template<typename dtype>
4072  NdArray<dtype> interp(const NdArray<dtype>& inX, const NdArray<dtype>& inXp, const NdArray<dtype>& inFp)
4073  {
4074  // do some error checking first
4075  if (inXp.size() != inFp.size())
4076  {
4077  std::string errStr = "ERROR: interp: inXp and inFp need to be the same size().";
4078  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4079  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4080  }
4081 
4082  if (inX.min().item() < inXp.min().item() || inX.max().item() > inXp.max().item())
4083  {
4084  std::string errStr = "ERROR: interp: endpoints of inX should be contained within inXp.";
4085  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4086  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4087  }
4088 
4089  // sort the input inXp and inFp data
4090  NdArray<uint32> sortedXpIdxs = argsort(inXp);
4091  NdArray<dtype> sortedXp(1, inFp.size());
4092  NdArray<dtype> sortedFp(1, inFp.size());
4093  for (uint32 i = 0; i < sortedXpIdxs.size(); ++i)
4094  {
4095  sortedXp[i] = inXp[sortedXpIdxs[i]];
4096  sortedFp[i] = inFp[sortedXpIdxs[i]];
4097  }
4098 
4099  // sort the input inX array
4100  NdArray<dtype> sortedX = sort(inX);
4101 
4102  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inX.size());
4103 
4104  uint32 currXpIdx = 0;
4105  uint32 currXidx = 0;
4106  while (currXidx < sortedX.size())
4107  {
4108  if (sortedXp[currXpIdx] <= sortedX[currXidx] && sortedX[currXidx] <= sortedXp[currXpIdx + 1])
4109  {
4110  double percent = static_cast<double>(sortedX[currXidx] - sortedXp[currXpIdx]) /
4111  static_cast<double>(sortedXp[currXpIdx + 1] - sortedXp[currXpIdx]);
4112  returnArray[currXidx++] = Utils::interp(sortedFp[currXpIdx], sortedFp[currXpIdx + 1], percent);
4113  }
4114  else
4115  {
4116  ++currXpIdx;
4117  }
4118  }
4119 
4120  return std::move(returnArray);
4121  }
4122 
4123  //============================================================================
4124  // Method Description:
4137  template<typename dtype>
4138  NdArray<dtype> intersect1d(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2)
4139  {
4140  std::vector<dtype> res(inArray1.size() + inArray2.size());
4141  std::set<dtype> in1(inArray1.cbegin(), inArray1.cend());
4142  std::set<dtype> in2(inArray2.cbegin(), inArray2.cend());
4143 
4144  typename std::vector<dtype>::iterator iter = std::set_intersection(in1.begin(), in1.end(),
4145  in2.begin(), in2.end(), res.begin());
4146  res.resize(iter - res.begin());
4147  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(res));
4148  }

4387  //============================================================================
4388  // Method Description:
4409  template<typename dtype>
4410  NdArray<dtype> linspace(dtype inStart, dtype inStop, uint32 inNum, bool endPoint)
4411  {
4412  if (inNum == 0)
4413  {
4414  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
4415  }
4416  else if (inNum == 1)
4417  {
4418  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { inStart };
4419  return std::move(returnArray);
4420  }
4421 
4422  if (inStop <= inStart)
4423  {
4424  std::string errStr = "ERROR: linspace: stop value must be greater than the start value.";
4425  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4426  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4427  }
4428 
4429  if (endPoint)
4430  {
4431  if (inNum == 2)
4432  {
4433  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { inStart, inStop };
4434  return std::move(returnArray);
4435  }
4436  else
4437  {
4438  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inNum);
4439  returnArray[0] = inStart;
4440  returnArray[inNum - 1] = inStop;
4441 
4442  dtype step = (inStop - inStart) / (inNum - 1);
4443  for (uint32 i = 1; i < inNum - 1; ++i)
4444  {
4445  returnArray[i] = returnArray[i - 1] + step;
4446  }
4447 
4448  return std::move(returnArray);
4449  }
4450  }
4451  else
4452  {
4453  if (inNum == 2)
4454  {
4455  dtype step = (inStop - inStart) / (inNum);
4456  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { inStart, inStart + step };
4457  return std::move(returnArray);
4458  }
4459  else
4460  {
4461  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inNum);
4462  returnArray[0] = inStart;
4463 
4464  dtype step = (inStop - inStart) / inNum;
4465  for (uint32 i = 1; i < inNum; ++i)
4466  {
4467  returnArray[i] = returnArray[i - 1] + step;
4468  }
4469 
4470  return std::move(returnArray);
4471  }
4472  }
4473  }

5078  //============================================================================
5079  // Method Description:
5090  template<typename dtype>
5091  NdArray<double> nanmean(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5092  {
5093  switch (inAxis)
5094  {
5095  case Axis::NONE:
5096  {
5097  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), 0.0,
5098  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + inValue2; }));
5099 
5100  double numberNonNan = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), 0.0,
5101  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + 1; }));
5102 
5103  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum /= numberNonNan };
5104 
5105  return std::move(returnArray);
5106  }
5107  case Axis::COL:
5108  {
5109  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5110  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5111  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5112  {
5113  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5114  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + inValue2; }));
5115 
5116  double numberNonNan = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5117  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + 1; }));
5118 
5119  returnArray(0, row) = sum / numberNonNan;
5120  }
5121 
5122  return std::move(returnArray);
5123  }
5124  case Axis::ROW:
5125  {
5126  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
5127  Shape transShape = transposedArray.shape();
5128  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, transShape.rows);
5129  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
5130  {
5131  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(transposedArray.cbegin(row), transposedArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5132  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + inValue2; }));
5133 
5134  double numberNonNan = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(transposedArray.cbegin(row), transposedArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5135  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + 1; }));
5136 
5137  returnArray(0, row) = sum / numberNonNan;
5138  }
5139 
5140  return std::move(returnArray);
5141  }
5142  default:
5143  {
5144  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5145  // of the compiler warning.
5146  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
5147  }
5148  }
5149  }

5152  // Method Description:
5163  template<typename dtype>
5164  NdArray<dtype> nanmedian(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5165  {
5166  switch (inAxis)
5167  {
5168  case Axis::NONE:
5169  {
5170  std::vector<dtype> values;
5171  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
5172  {
5173  if (!std::isnan(inArray[i]))
5174  {
5175  values.push_back(inArray[i]);
5176  }
5177  }
5178 
5179  uint32 middle = static_cast<uint32>(values.size()) / 2;
5180  std::nth_element(values.begin(), values.begin() + middle, values.end());
5181  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { values[middle] };
5182 
5183  return std::move(returnArray);
5184  }
5185  case Axis::COL:
5186  {
5187  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5188  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5189  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5190  {
5191  std::vector<dtype> values;
5192  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
5193  {
5194  if (!std::isnan(inArray(row, col)))
5195  {
5196  values.push_back(inArray(row, col));
5197  }
5198  }
5199 
5200  uint32 middle = static_cast<uint32>(values.size()) / 2;
5201  std::nth_element(values.begin(), values.begin() + middle, values.end());
5202  returnArray(0, row) = values[middle];
5203  }
5204 
5205  return std::move(returnArray);
5206  }
5207  case Axis::ROW:
5208  {
5209  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
5210  Shape inShape = transposedArray.shape();
5211  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5212  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5213  {
5214  std::vector<dtype> values;
5215  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
5216  {
5217  if (!std::isnan(transposedArray(row, col)))
5218  {
5219  values.push_back(transposedArray(row, col));
5220  }
5221  }
5222 
5223  uint32 middle = static_cast<uint32>(values.size()) / 2;
5224  std::nth_element(values.begin(), values.begin() + middle, values.end());
5225  returnArray(0, row) = values[middle];
5226  }
5227 
5228  return std::move(returnArray);
5229  }
5230  default:
5231  {
5232  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5233  // of the compiler warning.
5234  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
5235  }
5236  }
5237  }

5266  //============================================================================
5267  // Method Description:
5279  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
5280  NdArray<double> nanpercentile(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, double inPercentile, Axis inAxis, const std::string& inInterpMethod)
5281  {
5282  if (inPercentile < 0 || inPercentile > 100)
5283  {
5284  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input percentile value must be of the range [0, 100].";
5285  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
5286  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
5287  }
5288 
5289  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") != 0 &&
5290  inInterpMethod.compare("lower") != 0 &&
5291  inInterpMethod.compare("higher") != 0 &&
5292  inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") != 0 &&
5293  inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") != 0)
5294  {
5295  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input interpolation method is not a vaid option.\n";
5296  errStr += "\tValid options are 'linear', 'lower', 'higher', 'nearest', 'midpoint'.";
5297  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
5298  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
5299  }
5300 
5301  switch (inAxis)
5302  {
5303  case Axis::NONE:
5304  {
5305  if (inPercentile == 0)
5306  {
5307  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
5308  {
5309  if (!isnan(inArray[i]))
5310  {
5311  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(inArray[i]) };
5312  return std::move(returnArray);
5313  }
5314  }
5315  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5316  }
5317  else if (inPercentile == 1)
5318  {
5319  for (int32 i = static_cast<int32>(inArray.size()) - 1; i > -1; --i)
5320  {
5321  if (!isnan(inArray[i]))
5322  {
5323  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(inArray[i]) };
5324  return std::move(returnArray);
5325  }
5326  }
5327  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5328  }
5329 
5330  std::vector<double> arrayCopy;
5331  uint32 numNonNan = 0;
5332  for (uint32 j = 0; j < inArray.size(); ++j)
5333  {
5334  if (!isnan(inArray[j]))
5335  {
5336  arrayCopy.push_back(inArray[j]);
5337  ++numNonNan;
5338  }
5339  }
5340 
5341  if (arrayCopy.size() < 2)
5342  {
5343  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5344  }
5345 
5346  int32 i = static_cast<int32>(std::floor(static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1) * inPercentile / 100.0));
5347  uint32 indexLower = static_cast<uint32>(clip<uint32>(i, 0, numNonNan - 2));
5348 
5349  std::sort(arrayCopy.begin(), arrayCopy.end());
5350 
5351  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") == 0)
5352  {
5353  double percentI = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1);
5354  double fraction = (inPercentile / 100.0 - percentI) /
5355  (static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1) - percentI);
5356 
5357  double returnValue = arrayCopy[indexLower] + (arrayCopy[indexLower + 1] - arrayCopy[indexLower]) * fraction;
5358  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(returnValue) };
5359  return std::move(returnArray);
5360  }
5361  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("lower") == 0)
5362  {
5363  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
5364  return std::move(returnArray);
5365  }
5366  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("higher") == 0)
5367  {
5368  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
5369  return std::move(returnArray);
5370  }
5371  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") == 0)
5372  {
5373  double percent = inPercentile / 100.0;
5374  double percent1 = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1);
5375  double percent2 = static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1);
5376  double diff1 = percent - percent1;
5377  double diff2 = percent2 - percent;
5378 
5379  switch (argmin<double>({ diff1, diff2 }).item())
5380  {
5381  case 0:
5382  {
5383  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
5384  return std::move(returnArray);
5385  }
5386  case 1:
5387  {
5388  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
5389  return std::move(returnArray);
5390  }
5391  }
5392  }
5393  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") == 0)
5394  {
5395  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { (arrayCopy[indexLower] + arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) / 2.0 };
5396  return std::move(returnArray);
5397  }
5398  }
5399  case Axis::COL:
5400  {
5401  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5402 
5403  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5404  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5405  {
5406  NdArray<dtypeOut> outValue = nanpercentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row)),
5407  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod);
5408 
5409  if (outValue.size() == 1)
5410  {
5411  returnArray[row] = outValue.item();
5412  }
5413  else
5414  {
5415  returnArray[row] = Constants::nan;
5416  }
5417  }
5418 
5419  return std::move(returnArray);
5420  }
5421  case Axis::ROW:
5422  {
5423  NdArray<dtype> arrayTrans = inArray.transpose();
5424  Shape inShape = arrayTrans.shape();
5425 
5426  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5427  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5428  {
5429  NdArray<dtypeOut> outValue = nanpercentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(arrayTrans.cbegin(row), arrayTrans.cend(row)),
5430  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod);
5431 
5432  if (outValue.size() == 1)
5433  {
5434  returnArray[row] = outValue.item();
5435  }
5436  else
5437  {
5438  returnArray[row] = Constants::nan;
5439  }
5440  }
5441 
5442  return std::move(returnArray);
5443  }
5444  default:
5445  {
5446  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5447  // of the compiler warning.
5448  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5449  }
5450  }
5451  }

5454  // Method Description:
5465  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
5466  NdArray<dtypeOut> nanprod(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5467  {
5468  NdArray<dtype> arrayCopy(inArray);
5469  for (uint32 i = 0; i < arrayCopy.size(); ++i)
5470  {
5471  if (std::isnan(arrayCopy[i]))
5472  {
5473  arrayCopy[i] = 1;
5474  }
5475  }
5476 
5477  return std::move(prod<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy, inAxis));
5478  }

5528  //============================================================================
5529  // Method Description:
5537  template<typename dtype>
5538  NdArray<double> nans_like(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray)
5539  {
5540  NdArray<double> returnArray(inArray.shape());
5541  returnArray.nans();
5542  return std::move(returnArray);
5543  }
5544 
5545  //============================================================================
5546  // Method Description:
5557  template<typename dtype>
5558  NdArray<double> nanstd(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5559  {
5560  switch (inAxis)
5561  {
5562  case Axis::NONE:
5563  {
5564  double meanValue = nanmean(inArray, inAxis).item();
5565  double sum = 0;
5566  double counter = 0;
5567  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
5568  {
5569  if (std::isnan(inArray[i]))
5570  {
5571  continue;
5572  }
5573 
5574  sum += Utils::sqr(static_cast<double>(inArray[i]) - meanValue);
5575  ++counter;
5576  }
5577  NdArray<double> returnArray = { std::sqrt(sum / counter) };
5578  return std::move(returnArray);
5579  }
5580  case Axis::COL:
5581  {
5582  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5583  NdArray<double> meanValue = nanmean(inArray, inAxis);
5584  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5585  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5586  {
5587  double sum = 0;
5588  double counter = 0;
5589  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
5590  {
5591  if (std::isnan(inArray(row, col)))
5592  {
5593  continue;
5594  }
5595 
5596  sum += Utils::sqr(static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col)) - meanValue[row]);
5597  ++counter;
5598  }
5599  returnArray(0, row) = std::sqrt(sum / counter);
5600  }
5601 
5602  return std::move(returnArray);
5603  }
5604  case Axis::ROW:
5605  {
5606  NdArray<double> meanValue = nanmean(inArray, inAxis);
5607  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
5608  Shape inShape = transposedArray.shape();
5609  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5610  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5611  {
5612  double sum = 0;
5613  double counter = 0;
5614  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
5615  {
5616  if (std::isnan(transposedArray(row, col)))
5617  {
5618  continue;
5619  }
5620 
5621  sum += Utils::sqr(static_cast<double>(transposedArray(row, col)) - meanValue[row]);
5622  ++counter;
5623  }
5624  returnArray(0, row) = std::sqrt(sum / counter);
5625  }
5626 
5627  return std::move(returnArray);
5628  }
5629  default:
5630  {
5631  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5632  // of the compiler warning.
5633  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
5634  }
5635  }
5636  }
5637

5639  // Method Description:
5650  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
5651  NdArray<dtypeOut> nansum(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5652  {
5653  NdArray<dtype> arrayCopy(inArray);
5654  for (uint32 i = 0; i < arrayCopy.size(); ++i)
5655  {
5656  if (std::isnan(arrayCopy[i]))
5657  {
5658  arrayCopy[i] = 0;
5659  }
5660  }
5661 
5662  return std::move(sum<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy, inAxis));
5663  }

5938  //============================================================================
5939  // Method Description:
5956  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
5957  NdArray<dtypeOut> percentile(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, double inPercentile, Axis inAxis, const std::string& inInterpMethod)
5958  {
5959  if (inPercentile < 0 || inPercentile > 100)
5960  {
5961  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input percentile value must be of the range [0, 100].";
5962  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
5963  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
5964  }
5965 
5966  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") != 0 &&
5967  inInterpMethod.compare("lower") != 0 &&
5968  inInterpMethod.compare("higher") != 0 &&
5969  inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") != 0 &&
5970  inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") != 0)
5971  {
5972  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input interpolation method is not a vaid option.\n";
5973  errStr += "\tValid options are 'linear', 'lower', 'higher', 'nearest', 'midpoint'.";
5974  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
5975  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
5976  }
5977 
5978  switch (inAxis)
5979  {
5980  case Axis::NONE:
5981  {
5982  if (inPercentile == 0)
5983  {
5984  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(*inArray.cbegin()) };
5985  return std::move(returnArray);
5986  }
5987  else if (inPercentile == 1)
5988  {
5989  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(*inArray.cend()) };
5990  return std::move(returnArray);
5991  }
5992 
5993  int32 i = static_cast<int32>(std::floor(static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1) * inPercentile / 100.0));
5994  uint32 indexLower = static_cast<uint32>(clip<uint32>(i, 0, inArray.size() - 2));
5995 
5996  NdArray<double> arrayCopy = inArray.template astype<double>();
5997  std::sort(arrayCopy.begin(), arrayCopy.end());
5998 
5999  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") == 0)
6000  {
6001  double percentI = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1);
6002  double fraction = (inPercentile / 100.0 - percentI) /
6003  (static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1) - percentI);
6004 
6005  double returnValue = arrayCopy[indexLower] + (arrayCopy[indexLower + 1] - arrayCopy[indexLower]) * fraction;
6006  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(returnValue) };
6007  return std::move(returnArray);
6008  }
6009  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("lower") == 0)
6010  {
6011  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
6012  return std::move(returnArray);
6013  }
6014  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("higher") == 0)
6015  {
6016  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
6017  return std::move(returnArray);
6018  }
6019  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") == 0)
6020  {
6021  double percent = inPercentile / 100.0;
6022  double percent1 = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1);
6023  double percent2 = static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1);
6024  double diff1 = percent - percent1;
6025  double diff2 = percent2 - percent;
6026 
6027  switch (argmin<double>({ diff1, diff2 }).item())
6028  {
6029  case 0:
6030  {
6031  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
6032  return std::move(returnArray);
6033  }
6034  case 1:
6035  {
6036  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
6037  return std::move(returnArray);
6038  }
6039  }
6040  }
6041  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") == 0)
6042  {
6043  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>((arrayCopy[indexLower] + arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) / 2.0) };
6044  return std::move(returnArray);
6045  }
6046  }
6047  case Axis::COL:
6048  {
6049  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
6050 
6051  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
6052  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6053  {
6054  returnArray[row] = percentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row)),
6055  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod).item();
6056  }
6057 
6058  return std::move(returnArray);
6059  }
6060  case Axis::ROW:
6061  {
6062  NdArray<dtype> arrayTrans = inArray.transpose();
6063  Shape inShape = arrayTrans.shape();
6064 
6065  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
6066  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6067  {
6068  returnArray[row] = percentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(arrayTrans.cbegin(row), arrayTrans.cend(row)),
6069  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod).item();
6070  }
6071 
6072  return std::move(returnArray);
6073  }
6074  default:
6075  {
6076  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
6077  // of the compiler warning.
6078  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
6079  }
6080  }
6081  }
6082

6595  //============================================================================
6596  // Method Description:
6608  template<typename dtype>
6609  NdArray<dtype> roll(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, int32 inShift, Axis inAxis)
6610  {
6611  switch (inAxis)
6612  {
6613  case Axis::NONE:
6614  {
6615  uint32 shift = std::abs(inShift) % inArray.size();
6616  if (inShift > 0)
6617  {
6618  shift = inArray.size() - shift;
6619  }
6620 
6621  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
6622  std::rotate(returnArray.begin(), returnArray.begin() + shift, returnArray.end());
6623 
6624  return std::move(returnArray);
6625  }
6626  case Axis::COL:
6627  {
6628  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
6629 
6630  uint32 shift = std::abs(inShift) % inShape.cols;
6631  if (inShift > 0)
6632  {
6633  shift = inShape.cols - shift;
6634  }
6635 
6636  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
6637  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6638  {
6639  std::rotate(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.begin(row) + shift, returnArray.end(row));
6640  }
6641 
6642  return std::move(returnArray);
6643  }
6644  case Axis::ROW:
6645  {
6646  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
6647 
6648  uint32 shift = std::abs(inShift) % inShape.rows;
6649  if (inShift > 0)
6650  {
6651  shift = inShape.rows - shift;
6652  }
6653 
6654  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = inArray.transpose();
6655  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.cols; ++row)
6656  {
6657  std::rotate(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.begin(row) + shift, returnArray.end(row));
6658  }
6659 
6660  return std::move(returnArray.transpose());
6661  }
6662  default:
6663  {
6664  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
6665  // of the compiler warning.
6666  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
6667  }
6668  }
6669  }
6670 
6671  //============================================================================
6672  // Method Description:
6683  template<typename dtype>
6684  NdArray<dtype> rot90(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint8 inK)
6685  {
6686  inK %= 4;
6687  switch (inK)
6688  {
6689  case 1:
6690  {
6691  return std::move(flipud(inArray.transpose()));
6692  }
6693  case 2:
6694  {
6695  return std::move(flip(inArray, Axis::NONE));
6696  }
6697  case 3:
6698  {
6699  return std::move(fliplr(inArray.transpose()));
6700  }
6701  default:
6702  {
6703  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
6704  // of the compiler warning.
6705  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
6706  }
6707  }
6708  }

6743  //============================================================================
6744  // Method Description:
6753  template<typename dtype>
6754  NdArray<dtype> row_stack(const std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >& inArrayList)
6755  {
6756  // first loop through to calculate the final size of the array
6757  typename std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >::iterator iter;
6758  Shape finalShape;
6759  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
6760  {
6761  if (finalShape.isnull())
6762  {
6763  finalShape = iter->shape();
6764  }
6765  else if (iter->shape().cols != finalShape.cols)
6766  {
6767  std::string errStr = "ERROR: row_stack: input arrays must have the same number of columns.";
6768  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
6769  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
6770  }
6771  else
6772  {
6773  finalShape.rows += iter->shape().rows;
6774  }
6775  }
6776 
6777  // now that we know the final size, contruct the output array
6778  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(finalShape);
6779  uint32 rowStart = 0;
6780  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
6781  {
6782  Shape theShape = iter->shape();
6783  for (uint32 row = 0; row < theShape.rows; ++row)
6784  {
6785  for (uint32 col = 0; col < theShape.cols; ++col)
6786  {
6787  returnArray(rowStart + row, col) = iter->operator()(row, col);
6788  }
6789  }
6790  rowStart += theShape.rows;
6791  }
6792 
6793  return std::move(returnArray);
6794  }

6797  // Method Description:
6809  template<typename dtype>
6810  NdArray<dtype> setdiff1d(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2)
6811  {
6812  std::vector<dtype> res(inArray1.size() + inArray2.size());
6813  std::set<dtype> in1(inArray1.cbegin(), inArray1.cend());
6814  std::set<dtype> in2(inArray2.cbegin(), inArray2.cend());
6815 
6816  typename std::vector<dtype>::iterator iter = std::set_difference(in1.begin(), in1.end(),
6817  in2.begin(), in2.end(), res.begin());
6818  res.resize(iter - res.begin());
6819  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(res));
6820  }

7414  //============================================================================
7415  // Method Description:
7427  template<typename dtype>
7428  NdArray<double> trapz(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, double dx, Axis inAxis)
7429  {
7430  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
7431  switch (inAxis)
7432  {
7433  case Axis::COL:
7434  {
7435  NdArray<double> returnArray(inShape.rows, 1);
7436  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
7437  {
7438  double sum = 0;
7439  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols - 1; ++col)
7440  {
7441  sum += static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col + 1) - inArray(row, col)) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col));
7442  }
7443 
7444  returnArray[row] = sum * dx;
7445  }
7446 
7447  return std::move(returnArray);
7448  }
7449  case Axis::ROW:
7450  {
7451  NdArray<dtype> arrayTranspose = inArray.transpose();
7452  Shape transShape = arrayTranspose.shape();
7453  NdArray<double> returnArray(transShape.rows, 1);
7454  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
7455  {
7456  double sum = 0;
7457  for (uint32 col = 0; col < transShape.cols - 1; ++col)
7458  {
7459  sum += static_cast<double>(arrayTranspose(row, col + 1) - arrayTranspose(row, col)) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(arrayTranspose(row, col));
7460  }
7461 
7462  returnArray[row] = sum * dx;
7463  }
7464 
7465  return std::move(returnArray);
7466  }
7467  case Axis::NONE:
7468  {
7469  double sum = 0.0;
7470  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size() - 1; ++i)
7471  {
7472  sum += static_cast<double>(inArray[i + 1] - inArray[i]) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArray[i]);
7473  }
7474 
7475  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum * dx };
7476  return std::move(returnArray);
7477  }
7478  default:
7479  {
7480  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
7481  // of the compiler warning.
7482  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
7483  }
7484  }
7485  }

7487  //============================================================================
7488  // Method Description:
7500  template<typename dtype>
7501  NdArray<double> trapz(const NdArray<dtype>& inArrayY, const NdArray<dtype>& inArrayX, Axis inAxis)
7502  {
7503  Shape inShapeY = inArrayY.shape();
7504  Shape inShapeX = inArrayX.shape();
7505 
7506  if (inShapeY != inShapeX)
7507  {
7508  std::string errStr = "ERROR: trapz: input x and y arrays should be the same shape.";
7509  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
7510  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
7511  }
7512 
7513  switch (inAxis)
7514  {
7515  case Axis::COL:
7516  {
7517  NdArray<double> returnArray(inShapeY.rows, 1);
7518  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShapeY.rows; ++row)
7519  {
7520  double sum = 0;
7521  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShapeY.cols - 1; ++col)
7522  {
7523  double dx = static_cast<double>(inArrayX(row, col + 1) - inArrayX(row, col));
7524  sum += dx * (static_cast<double>(inArrayY(row, col + 1) - inArrayY(row, col)) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArrayY(row, col)));
7525  }
7526 
7527  returnArray[row] = sum;
7528  }
7529 
7530  return std::move(returnArray);
7531  }
7532  case Axis::ROW:
7533  {
7534  NdArray<dtype> arrayYTranspose = inArrayY.transpose();
7535  NdArray<dtype> arrayXTranspose = inArrayX.transpose();
7536  Shape transShape = arrayYTranspose.shape();
7537  NdArray<double> returnArray(transShape.rows, 1);
7538  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
7539  {
7540  double sum = 0;
7541  for (uint32 col = 0; col < transShape.cols - 1; ++col)
7542  {
7543  double dx = static_cast<double>(arrayXTranspose(row, col + 1) - arrayXTranspose(row, col));
7544  sum += dx * (static_cast<double>(arrayYTranspose(row, col + 1) - arrayYTranspose(row, col)) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(arrayYTranspose(row, col)));
7545  }
7546 
7547  returnArray[row] = sum;
7548  }
7549 
7550  return std::move(returnArray);
7551  }
7552  case Axis::NONE:
7553  {
7554  double sum = 0.0;
7555  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArrayY.size() - 1; ++i)
7556  {
7557  double dx = static_cast<double>(inArrayX[i + 1] - inArrayX[i]);
7558  sum += dx * (static_cast<double>(inArrayY[i + 1] - inArrayY[i]) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArrayY[i]));
7559  }
7560 
7561  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum };
7562  return std::move(returnArray);
7563  }
7564  default:
7565  {
7566  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
7567  // of the compiler warning.
7568  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
7569  }
7570  }
7571  }

7574  // Method Description:
7586  template<typename dtype>
7587  NdArray<dtype> tril(uint32 inN, int32 inOffset)
7588  {
7589  uint32 rowStart = 0;
7590  uint32 colStart = 0;
7591  if (inOffset > 0)
7592  {
7593  colStart = inOffset;
7594  }
7595  else
7596  {
7597  rowStart = inOffset * -1;
7598  }
7599 
7600  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inN);
7601  returnArray.zeros();
7602  for (uint32 row = rowStart; row < inN; ++row)
7603  {
7604  for (uint32 col = 0; col < row + colStart + 1 - rowStart; ++col)
7605  {
7606  if (col == inN)
7607  {
7608  break;
7609  }
7610 
7611  returnArray(row, col) = static_cast<dtype>(1);
7612  }
7613  }
7614 
7615  return std::move(returnArray);
7616  }

7709  //============================================================================
7710  // Method Description:
7723  template<typename dtype>
7724  NdArray<dtype> triu(uint32 inN, uint32 inM, int32 inOffset)
7725  {
7726  // because i'm stealing the lines of code from tril and reversing it, this is necessary
7727  inOffset -= 1;
7728 
7729  uint32 rowStart = 0;
7730  uint32 colStart = 0;
7731  if (inOffset > 0)
7732  {
7733  colStart = inOffset;
7734  }
7735  else if (inOffset < 0)
7736  {
7737  rowStart = inOffset * -1;
7738  }
7739 
7740  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inN, inM);
7741  returnArray.ones();
7742  for (uint32 row = rowStart; row < inN; ++row)
7743  {
7744  for (uint32 col = 0; col < row + colStart + 1 - rowStart; ++col)
7745  {
7746  if (col == inM)
7747  {
7748  break;
7749  }
7750 
7751  returnArray(row, col) = static_cast<dtype>(0);
7752  }
7753  }
7754 
7755  return std::move(returnArray);
7756  }
7757 
7758  //============================================================================
7759  // Method Description:
7775  template<typename dtype>
7776  NdArray<dtype> triu(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, int32 inOffset)
7777  {
7778  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
7779  auto outArray = inArray.copy();
7780  outArray.putMask(tril<bool>(inShape.rows, inShape.cols, inOffset - 1), 0);
7781  return std::move(outArray);
7782  }
7783 
7784  //============================================================================
7785  // Method Description:
7796  template<typename dtype>
7797  NdArray<dtype> trim_zeros(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const std::string inTrim)
7798  {
7799  if (inTrim == "f")
7800  {
7801  uint32 place = 0;
7802  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
7803  {
7804  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
7805  {
7806  break;
7807  }
7808  else
7809  {
7810  ++place;
7811  }
7812  }
7813 
7814  if (place == inArray.size())
7815  {
7816  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
7817  }
7818 
7819  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inArray.size() - place);
7820  std::copy(inArray.cbegin() + place, inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin());
7821 
7822  return std::move(returnArray);
7823  }
7824  else if (inTrim == "b")
7825  {
7826  uint32 place = inArray.size();
7827  for (uint32 i = inArray.size() - 1; i > 0; --i)
7828  {
7829  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
7830  {
7831  break;
7832  }
7833  else
7834  {
7835  --place;
7836  }
7837  }
7838 
7839  if (place == 0 || (place == 1 && inArray[0] == 0))
7840  {
7841  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
7842  }
7843 
7844  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, place);
7845  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cbegin() + place, returnArray.begin());
7846 
7847  return std::move(returnArray);
7848  }
7849  else if (inTrim == "fb")
7850  {
7851  uint32 placeBegin = 0;
7852  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
7853  {
7854  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
7855  {
7856  break;
7857  }
7858  else
7859  {
7860  ++placeBegin;
7861  }
7862  }
7863 
7864  if (placeBegin == inArray.size())
7865  {
7866  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
7867  }
7868 
7869  uint32 placeEnd = inArray.size();
7870  for (uint32 i = inArray.size() - 1; i > 0; --i)
7871  {
7872  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
7873  {
7874  break;
7875  }
7876  else
7877  {
7878  --placeEnd;
7879  }
7880  }
7881 
7882  if (placeEnd == 0 || (placeEnd == 1 && inArray[0] == 0))
7883  {
7884  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
7885  }
7886 
7887  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, placeEnd - placeBegin);
7888  std::copy(inArray.cbegin() + placeBegin, inArray.cbegin() + placeEnd, returnArray.begin());
7889 
7890  return std::move(returnArray);
7891  }
7892  else
7893  {
7894  std::string errStr = "ERROR: trim_zeros: trim options are 'f' = front, 'b' = back, 'fb' = front and back.";
7895  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
7896  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
7897  }
7898  }
7899

7954  template<typename dtype>
7955  NdArray<dtype> union1d(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2)
7956  {
7957  if (inArray1.shape() != inArray2.shape())
7958  {
7959  std::string errStr = "ERROR: union1d: input array shapes are not consistant.";
7960  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
7961  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
7962  }
7963 
7964  std::set<dtype> theSet(inArray1.cbegin(), inArray1.cend());
7965  theSet.insert(inArray2.cbegin(), inArray2.cend());
7966  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(theSet));

7990  //============================================================================
7991  // Method Description:
8002  template<typename dtype>
8003  dtype unwrap(dtype inValue)
8004  {
8005  if (inValue < 0)
8006  {
8007  return inValue + 2 * Constants::pi;
8008  }
8009  else if (inValue >= 2 * Constants::pi)
8010  {
8011  return inValue - 2 * Constants::pi;
8012  }
8013  else
8014  {
8015  return inValue;
8016  }
8017  }
8018

8077  //============================================================================
8078  // Method Description:
8090  template<typename dtype>
8091  NdArray<dtype> where(const NdArray<bool>& inMask, const NdArray<dtype>& inA, const NdArray<dtype>& inB)
8092  {
8093  auto shapeMask = inMask.shape();
8094  auto shapeA = inA.shape();
8095  if (shapeA != inB.shape())
8096  {
8097  std::string errStr = "ERROR: where: input inA and inB must be the same shapes.";
8098  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8099  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8100  }
8101 
8102  if (shapeMask != shapeA)
8103  {
8104  std::string errStr = "ERROR: where: input inMask must be the same shape as the input arrays.";
8105  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8106  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8107  }
8108 
8109  auto outArray = NdArray<dtype>(shapeMask);
8110 
8111  for (uint32 i = 0; i < shapeMask.size(); ++i)
8112  {
8113  if (inMask[i])
8114  {
8115  outArray[i] = inA[i];
8116  }
8117  else
8118  {
8119  outArray[i] = inB[i];
8120  }
8121  }
8122 
8123  return std::move(outArray);
8124  }
